record.dc:title: 60BY11 Rymer, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burials 15BY96, 97, 98, 100, and 101. Square 1R18. Direction SE.
record.wpa:narrative: [15BY96] Indeterminate child in poor condition, extended on back with head to NW. Bone in advanced state of deterioration. [15BY97] Mature male in fair condition, extended on back with head to NE. Triangular projectile point imbedded between 5 and 6 rib on left side of burial 97, suggests possible cause of demise. Point of projectile is toward spine. Miscellaneous long bones and pelvis of two individuals buried along lower legs of 15BY97--possible that 15BY97 was intrusive to the two individuals (15BY100, 15BY101) which were reburied with 15BY97. [15BY98] Mature male in poor condition, extended on back, head to SW. Bones in advanced state of deterioration. [15BY100] Adult male(?) in fair condition, bundle burial at legs of burial 97. Apparently reburied in pit with burial 97 and 101. Burial 100 above 101. [15BY101] Indeterminate adult in fair condition, bundle burial at legs of burial 97. Along the lower left leg of 15BY97 and under 15BY100.
